How can the sponsor ensure proper disposal of unused investigational drug product if the participant cannot return to the study site? FDA regulations outline sponsor and investigator responsibilities for storage conditions and accountability of investigational drug products, including disposition of unused IPs.22 Under 21 CFR 312.59, the sponsor shall assure the return of all unused supplies of the investigational drug from each individual investigator. The regulation further provides that the sponsor may authorize alternative disposition of unused supplies of the investigational drug, provided this alternative does not expose humans to risks from the drug. The procedure for disposition is generally considered part of the investigational plan and is normally described in the study protocol as a study-specific plan for handling the IPs. In most protocols, such plans involve the participant bringing the unused IP to the clinical trial site and then the investigator returning the unused IP to the sponsor or its designee.
